Overview:

This course is appropriate for new utility employees and those new to the planning department, as well as supervisors and managers who need a quick overview on the entire planning function and how it is done by other utilities. 
It will familiarize the attendee with modern power distribution and service planning concepts and practices and the way their job fits into the overall utility. 
The course covers the basic steps in planning and how they integrate with other functions, data sources and processes within the larger organization. Goals and steps in planning are covered. 
Basic tools and methodology for planning are reviewed as are traditional, modern, and “asset management” approaches to planning. 
All processes involved in development of the work plan, from the initial load forecasts to the final project implementation and approval are covered.

Overview:

This course is designed to provide an in depth overview of all areas of systems, components, and calculations relevant to distribution engineering. 
It is perfect for anyone needing a thorough review of theory and calculations used in their day to day work and is suitable for engineers of all experience levels. 
There is a strong focus on real-life problems which are used to teach the various methods and concepts. Each topic is concluded with practical application methods and principles that can be used in day to day work.
What You Will Learn
You will be presented with the theories behind the various calculations used and are then left with practical, simplified methods and rules of thumb that yield accurate results.
Topics include:


System Design Principles

Equipment Loading Practices

Transformer Connections

Power Flow, Voltage Drop and Fault Calculations

System Protection and Coordination
      Reliability

Application of Capacitors

Voltage Regulation

Electrical Losses
